description: The Justice tarot card is a symbol of truth, fairness, and law. As she sits in her chair, the scales in her left hand represent how intuition should balance logic. She symbolizes impartiality with the double-edged sword in her right hand. The clarity in thought which is required to dispense justice are symbolized by the square on the crown she wears. Behind her, there is a purple cloak and standing grey pillars. Beneath her red cloak, which is held together by a clasp, she shows the tip of a white shoe. This is a spiritual reminder that what she delivers are the outcomes of their actions.

upright.overview:
The decisions that you make now have long-term effects in all things, both for yourself and others. There will always come a time where you will be judged. The Justice tarot card appearing in a reading signals that a judgment will be made fairly and accordingly. The decisions that you have made in the past will be carefully weighed with fairness. Your feelings around this card may differ depending on your situation.

If you have been wronged, this card's appearance may bring you relief. On the other hand, if your actions caused pain to others, this card serves as a warning. Her appearance represents a chance for you to change your actions now for a better future. When a tarot card reading shows the figure of justice, it is time to account for your actions.

If you have been wronged, this card's appearance may bring you relief. On the other hand, if your actions caused pain to others, this card serves as a warning.

Another meaning of the Justice card is truth. Truth must come to pass, and this cannot be found from the mouths and gossip of others. Instead, it's based on facts. Learn the truth about others and yourself, speak and know the truth before passing a judgment. During a reading, when you see the Justice Tarot card, you need to be fair in all your deeds. By following the right procedure to learn the truth, you will understand what your tasks are.
Another meaning of Justice Tarot card during a reading is to symbolize that attention is needed. It could be about your life, career or just an important decision that you need to make. If you have been unsure about something, it is time to get a solution once and for all.
upright.love_meaning:
Justice is about karma, and if you’ve been putting forth the effort, love and romance will be coming your way. If you’ve been kind, loving and supportive, your relationships will be a mirror of what you’ve been giving to others. If you’ve been single, your loving and positive disposition will make you especially attractive to new potential romances.
Because this card is all about the law of cause and effect, make sure you have been treating your partner fairly. Watch out for resentment and defensiveness, and ensure that conflicts in your relationships are handled with respect and trust in your other half. Compromise and understanding is needed now. Sometimes this card is also about being tactful, and expressing your frustrations in a way that are mindful of your partner’s feelings. As long as issues hare handled with honesty and good faith, your relationship will thrive.
upright.career_meaning: If you’ve been involved in any workplace disputes, the Justice card can signal that everything should work out in your favor as long as you’ve been truthful, honest and fair with your dealings. If this doesn’t apply to you, this card can simply be a reminder to always act with integrity, and ensure that you take responsibility for your actions, even when you make a mistake. As scary as this can be sometimes, others will trust and respect you for your honesty and commitment to truth. With fair and balanced dealings, your career can flourish.
upright.finances_meaning: This card is a reminder to keep things honest, just and fair when it comes to your financial dealings. Ensure that you balance your needs with others, and that what you take is balanced with what you give. Continue to keep things balanced, and your finances should be just fine.
upright.as_feelings:
The upright Justice card reveals how someone feels about you, showing that they approach their emotions with a level-headed and analytical mindset. Their feelings aren’t just driven by chemistry; they reflect on how you've treated them in the past. If your interactions have been filled with kindness and respect, expect those positive vibes to return tenfold. On the other hand, if negativity or hurt has marked your relationship, they're acutely aware of it and feel accordingly.
This card serves as a mirror for your own feelings, prompting introspection about fairness and balance within yourself. You might be wrestling with questions of integrity or seeking clarity in your emotional landscape. Justice urges you to evaluate whether you're being true to yourself while also considering how your actions align with what you desire from others.
upright.as_actions: Guided by the Justice card, now is the time for you to seek balance and fairness in your actions. This means evaluating situations with a clear mind and making decisions based on truth rather than emotion. You should focus on being honest with yourself and others, ensuring that your choices reflect integrity. Consider addressing any unresolved conflicts by having open conversations where you express your feelings while also listening to others' perspectives. Additionally, take steps to align your daily actions with your values; this could involve volunteering or advocating for causes that resonate with you, reinforcing a sense of justice in both personal and community matters.
upright.love: romantic efforts rewarded, compromise, treating partner fairly
upright.career: integrity at work rewarded, remaining accountable and fair
upright.finances: balancing finances, balancing giving and taking

reversed.overview: A reversed Justice tarot card could indicate various things. One Justice reversal meaning is to show you are living in denial. You are not willing to accept the consequences of your actions or others. You are running from your guilt. You must however, be aware that these are actions that are in the past. Your future depends on your actions today - and what you will do to tip the scales in balance again. How can you make up for your wrongs? Taking action gives you a chance to change and stop judging yourself. In legal matters, this could represent an unfair outcome of a case that you will not accept.
reversed.love_meaning: Sometimes, love and romance can be unfair. You may be doing your part in putting yourself out in the world, but luck is still not on your side. Whatever the case may be, sometimes one must grit their teeth and carry on. Now may also be a good time to check whether your are being fair with your expectations about love. Are you looking for someone absolutely perfect, but are unable or unwilling to work on your own flaws? Be honest with your requirements, as well as your own baggage. If you’re in a relationship, this may be a difficult time, and fairness and compromise are needed more than ever. Don’t blame others, or your partner for things that are your responsibility.
reversed.career_meaning: You may be dealing with some unfair situations at work right now. This can mean taking the blame for someone else, or others attempting to undermine the quality of your work. While it may be tempting to fight fire with fire, this can only worsen the issue. Remain reasonable, logical and forthright with how you handle this situation. With reversed Justice, you may find that heated confrontations can mean the blame will rest on you. Sometimes, this card can also signal that you haven’t quite been honest when it comes to your career. This can lead to trouble for you in the future; or even if it doesn’t, can lead to continued anxiety as you wonder when the other shoe will drop. If you still have time, make amends and change your habits now. If you have been avoiding accountability for a mistake and hoping that the blame may fall on others, not only are you eroding trust between you and your colleagues, but you are also throwing away a chance to learn from your mistakes and grow.
reversed.finances_meaning: Some dishonesty is present regarding your finances when the reversed Justice card appears in your reading. Be cautious about who you share your financial information with, and ensure that they can be trusted before going forward. If you’ve been having a hard time with your finances, the reversed Justice card can also signal failure to take accountability for your situation. Taking responsibility for a difficult situation can sound unpleasant, but it can also be empowering.
reversed.as_feelings:
When the reversed Justice card appears in relation to how someone feels about you, it reveals a sense of imbalance and confusion in their emotions. They may feel that fairness has been compromised, leading them to question your intentions or the dynamics of your relationship. Their feelings are clouded by past grievances or perceived injustices, making it difficult for them to fully embrace what could be a positive connection.
As you navigate your own feelings, this card suggests that you might be grappling with self-doubt and uncertainty. You could be feeling as though things are not aligning as they should, prompting introspection about whether you've acted justly in this situation. This reflection can lead to deeper insights into both yourself and the relationship at hand, urging you to seek clarity before moving forward.
reversed.as_actions: In the presence of the reversed Justice card, you’re encouraged to take a step back and reassess your current situation. It indicates a need for introspection regarding fairness and balance in your life. You may be overlooking important truths or avoiding accountability, so now is the time to confront any imbalances head-on. Consider journaling about areas where you feel wronged or have wronged others, allowing yourself to process these feelings honestly. Engage in open conversations with those affected by your decisions, seeking clarity and resolution. This period of reflection will help you realign with your values and restore harmony in both personal and professional relationships.
reversed.love: unfair romantic expectations, blaming partner unfairly
reversed.career: unfair work environment, dishonesty in career, not being accountable
reversed.finances: untrustworthy financial dealings, avoiding financial accountability

abyss: Justice is fierce, but fair. She holds the scales of positive and negative forces with her eye, constantly scrutinizing and weighing our decisions. Yet still she stands, staring straight into our eyes, looking deep into our soul. Justice can see the most hidden of our intentions; she can sense if our choices and actions are based on truth or deception. In a sense, she represents our inner voice of reason and conscience. She knows no grey area; her judgment is stark and absolute. However, remember that unlike us, she can see the bigger picture. You only have one chance to present your case before her, so make it count and don't try to trick her keen eye. When Justice appears know that all will be revealed, for better or worse. Everything hidden will make its way to the surface in true revelation. This card can indicate legal proceedings or lawsuits. One way or another the truth must come out. If you have been wronged or if you have wronged someone else, justice will prevail. All will be judged for their actions, so act responsibly and be honest with yourself and others. Perhaps there are some big decisions that need to be made at this time. If so, the Justice card can also indicate the need to consider those choices carefully. Balance is key in all things. Hence, remove anything that is in excess or difficult. Useless things must be put away in order to restore equilibrium.
